column1: Blood that flows between different chambers of your heart must flow through a heart valve.
In open heart surgery, the surgeon makes a large surgical cut in your breastbone to reach the heart and aorta.

The risks for cardiac surgery include: - Death - Heart attack - Irregular heartbeat (arrhythmia) - Kidney failure - Post-pericardiotomy syndrome -- low fever and chest pain that can last for up to 6 months - Stroke or other temporary or permanent brain injury - Temporary confusion after surgery due to the heart-lung machine It is very important to take steps to prevent valve infections.
The operation can relieve your symptoms and prolong your life.
